________________________________________________________________________
  

Spark   - New Zealand

NWPU (Waipu)-NUTI (Uretiti) radio link

Link Budget Calculation
_______________________________________________________________________
Link Analysis

In this document, link budget calculation related to one MW link in New Zealand is performed; the link is shown in the following figure, while the sites coordinates, provided by the Customer, are listed in Table 1.

Figure 1 - Network Topology





Table 1 - Site Coordinates


The link will be planned using the following configuration:

Radio Equipment:
IDU: SIAE “AGS20“;
ODU: SIAE “ASNK”;
Frequency: 13[GHz];
Channel Bandwidth: 56[MHz];
Modulation schema: ACM
Reference Modulation Level: 4QAM
Maximum Modulation Level: 512QAM
Configuration: 2+0 XPIC
Antenna diameters: 0.3mt (NWPU Waipu site) – 0.3mt (NUTI Uretiti site), as requested by the customer

The propagation parameters have been considered accordingly with sites coordinates provided by the Customer and using Recommendation ITU-R P530.17 (propagation prediction method for the fading estimation). Possible anomalous propagation phenomena (such as ground reflections) are not taken into account.

Rainfall intensity has been estimated using Recommendation ITU-R PN.838-3 in order to predict the attenuation due to precipitation. A value of 44.99 mm/h, not exceeded for the 0.01% of time, has been assumed for the radio link in accordance with the ITU-R rain map.

A preliminary visibility analysis has been performed on digital maps to verify the LOS between the involved sites, considering 15mt antenna height for NWPU (Waipu) site and 10mt for NUTI (Uretiti) site, as provided by the customer. The resultant profile is shown in paragraph 3. The exploited digital terrain maps do not take into account of any artificial (e.g. buildings, etc.) and natural (e.g. rocks, trees etc.) obstacles. SIAE recommends an analysis on field in order to verify the visibility between all the involved sites, since all calculations are valid under the assumption of clear LOS between the terminal sites.

Moreover, unknowing the network situation, the performed calculations don’t take into account of any degradation due to hypothetical interferences coming from both SIAE or other vendors’ equipment operating in the same area.

The antenna dimensioning proposed by the customer achieve the availability and quality objective of 99.999% of time at the reference modulation and of 99.9% at the maximum modulation at BER=10-6, as requested by the customer.

The following are the conclusions that emerge from our analysis:
 the link reaches the availability and quality objectives previously defined
a minimum fade margin of at least 10dB has been considered at the maximum modulation level
a XPIC configuration has been design to achieve the performance objective defined above, as requested by the customer

For more details about the dimensional parameters and results, please refer to the figures in the following paragraph.
